definition: slightly cold/cool/(neologism) (slang) to be done for/about to be obliterated/(of a place or a person) desolate

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)

sentences.english: It is nothing special, it feels cold in my stomach," said Siti Qomariyah, who has been eating the snacks since she was a child.
sentences.chinese: 这没什么特别的，感觉胃里凉凉的。

sentences.english: People say that a cold wet nose is an indicator of health in dogs or cats.
sentences.chinese: 据说凉凉的湿鼻子表示猫狗健康无病。

sentences.english: I am delighted to have the cool waters of a brook rush through my open fingers.
sentences.chinese: 让凉凉的溪水从张开的手指间冲过，令我感觉愉悦。

sentences.english: Boil drinking water for minutes, allow to cool to 50℃.
sentences.chinese: 将水煮开几分钟，让其凉凉到50度。

sentences.english: Jade is always cool to the touch and will resist to scratching with metal.
sentences.chinese: 玉摸上去总是凉凉的，而且还能抗金属划痕。

sentences.english: You said the sun September cool.
sentences.chinese: 你说九月的阳光凉凉的。

sentences.english: Worried the shade like this, easily falls the eyeground , that kind of cool autumn chill.
sentences.chinese: 一丝愁影就这样，轻易滑落眼底，那种凉凉的秋意。

sentences.english: He picked up one pebble, and, when it felt cold, he threw it into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一棵鹅卵石，当他感到凉凉的便将它仍入大海。

sentences.english: I lay down on the grass. The cool summer breeze blew over me.
sentences.chinese: 我躺在草地上，凉凉的夏风吹拂着我。

sentences.english: In summer I like to put the watermelon in the fridge to cool.
sentences.chinese: 夏天我喜欢把西瓜放冰箱里凉凉。

sentences.english: Wind blowing gently, feeling cool, which is very comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 风儿轻轻地吹着，感触凉凉的，很恬逸的哪一种。

sentences.english: Cecil cool, so charming the sweet-scented osmanthus in autumn withdrew earlier stage.
sentences.chinese: 丝丝凉凉，让娇美的桂花早些退下了秋的舞台。

sentences.english: In October, not cool late autumn.
Soon came down the raindrops, as big as beans, dropping onto my skin, cool and painful.
sentences.chinese: 有豆大的雨点落下来，砸在皮肤上凉凉的疼。

definition: the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
Nuannuan district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
(usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
